meanings.definition: To study or specialize in a particular subject as a secondary focus in college or university.
meanings.sent1: She minored in Spanish while majoring in Biology.
meanings.sent2: He minored in Economics to complement his major in Political Science.
meanings.sent3: The student minored in Art History, making her a well-rounded scholar.
meanings.sent4: His passion for languages led him to minor in French, adding depth to his studies.
meanings.sent5: Minoring in Psychology allowed her to explore the human mind in depth.

meanings.definition: To have a minor role or position in something.
meanings.sent1: He minored in the school play, playing a tree in the background.
meanings.sent2: She minored in the project, providing support wherever needed.
meanings.sent3: The cat minored in the family photo, sitting quietly in the corner.
meanings.sent4: His character minored in the movie, appearing briefly in a single scene.
meanings.sent5: The extra minored in the TV show, blending into the crowd scene seamlessly.
